sub_title: Global Connectivity | Value Creation | Transformation | Corporate Culture | Education | Growth
summary:
30 years in global business development > I steer growth; drive transformation; support change; lecture university master courses

ACHIEVEMENTS
• 7 years of expat experience in GCC
• Spearheaded launch of logistics branch in US
• Established partnerships for logistics in Qatar/Oman
• Opened talks on eCommerce logistics in EU
• Initiated opening of 34 air/sea service points in South Asia
• Drove setup of CEE Logistics Centre for Hungarian Post
• Accomplished multimillion euro M&A for Austrian Post in CEE
• Pioneered logistics for DHL Hungary, 1994
• Serial expert guest university lecturer on <Economies, Business Development & Logistics in the Gulf region>
• Mentored EU Trade Delegations in the Gulf
• Drove introduction of CRMs
• Implemented transformation & diversification in EU/GCC
• Utilised cross-functional compatibility to eliminate Silo effect
• Ignited meetings with Ministers
• Interacted with Corps Diplomatique worldwide
• Produced exhibitions in EU, GCC
• Organised, participated at Press Conference, prepared Press Releases
• Accomplished pharma projects in GCC
• Delivered Ad campaigns for FMCG majors across the world

STRENGTHS & SKILLS
• Creator of Value
• Global connectivity at C-suite level
• Impactful in private & public sectors worldwide
• Global mind - Effective functioning in multicultural environment
• Influential presenter & Communicator with strong global networking acumen
• Positive attitude
• Resilient
• Problem solver
• English, Hungarian, Spanish, Arabic, German, Russian
• Poise under pressure
• Look & sound of a leader
• Thought leadership
• Outgoing yet Introspective     
• Engaged & Attentive
• Cross-functional compatibility
• Educating/Mentoring/Inspiring teams
• Sharing credit with others 

SPECIALTIES & EXPERIENCES
• Global Business Development
• Synchromodality/Logistics/SCM
• Aviation/Air Express
• Transformation/M&A
• Change Management
• Postal operators
• Renewables
• Exhibitions
• FMCG
• Industrial manufacturing

I highly appreciated the opportunity provided for me to transfer part of my knowledge and experiences to the students of the University.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E2DAQHUgCxEUytt7g/profile-treasury-image-shrink_800_800/0/1601346649894?e=1692950400&v=beta&t=DkhQwHw6jOKJ5Rj6ssdUsoxbHWjw_gvbdTUJekK63w0'}, {'url': None, 'title': 'Budapest Corvinus University', 'description': 'Presentation to students of a Master Course at CORVINUS University, Hungary, on "Business Development, Investment & Innovation influenced by the crisis in the Gulf", Faculty of Int\'l Entrepreneurship and Innovation, Sept 2017.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E2DAQHeRRpX5T87XQ/profile-treasury-image-shrink_8192_8192/0/1602170156555?e=1692950400&v=beta&t=e22-IIBuz6qFTlPoFoEXS0UWJKg4k9XVYDasPX9L4hg'}]

awards: [{'title': 'University Guest Lecturer on "Business in the Gulf region - Business Development, Investment & Innovation for SMEs', 'description': 'Once again, invited by Prof. Attila Szilárd IVÁNYI, Dean of Faculty of International Entrepreneurship & Business Development, I presented "Economies of the Gulf region, Business Development, Investment following the boycott imposed on Qatar on 5th June, 2017 as well as other regional developments in 2018/19 – Opportunities for Hungarian SMEs to enter the markets of GCC", as part of the Master Course "International Business Development & Innovation" for final-year students of 2018/19. ', 'issuer': 'CORVINUS University, Faculty of Int’l Entrepreneurship & Business Development, Hungary', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, {'title': 'University Guest Lecturer on "Business in the Gulf region - Business Development, Investment & Innovation for SMEs"', 'description': 'Invited by Prof. Attila Szilárd IVÁNYI, Dean of Faculty of International Entrepreneurship & Business Development, I presented "Business Environment of the Gulf ever since 5 June, 2017 and in the light of the latest regional developments – Opportunities for Hungarian SMEs to enter the Gulf markets", as part of the Master Course "International Business Development & Innovation" in 2018.', 'issuer': 'CORVINUS University, Faculty of Int’l Entrepreneurship & Business Development, Hungary', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, {'title': 'University Guest Lecturer in English language on "Business environment of the GCC"', 'description': 'Invited by Prof. Alfonz Antoni, Head of Faculty of International Business Communication and Logistics / Supply Chain Management, I presented in English language for foreign students on "Economies, Business development, Investment & Innovation in the GCC – A general overview"', 'issuer': 'Budapest METROPOLITAN University, Faculty of International Business Communication & Logistics/Supply Chain, Hungary', 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'University Guest Lecturer on "Logistics and Supply Chain Management in the GCC"', 'description': 'Invited by Prof. Alfonz ANTONI, Head of Faculty of International Business Communication and Logistics / Supply Chain Management, I presented in Hungarian language "Logistics / Supply Chain Management in the GCC – Business Continuity" in October 2017.', 'issuer': "Budapest METROPOLITAN University, Faculty of Int'l Business Communication & Logistics/Supply Chain, Hungary", 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'University Guest Lecturer on "Business in the GCC - Business Development, Investment & Innovation for SMEs"', 'description': 'Invited by Prof. Attila IVANYI, Dean of Faculty of International Entrepreneurship & Innovation, I did the honours to introduce "Business in the Gulf Region - Business Development, Investment & Innovation - During and After The Crisis" to the students of a Master Course This introduction - initiated by the Dean - was held as special part of a series of Master Course lectures , titled "International Business Development and Innovation", where I was invited as Middle East Specialist. I truly appreciated this opportunity provided by Prof. Ivanyi for me to transfer part of my expert knowledge and experiences to students with options for further talks and different interactions for the Master Course students.', 'issuer': 'CORVINUS University in Budapest, Hungary', 'date': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'Guest of Honour Head of Examination Board on Sales & Marketing and Business Administration', 'description': "As specialist guest, at the invitation of the Owners of the Philippino Institute in Qatar, I did the honours to take part as Guest of Honour Head of Examination Board during the academic year's final examination of the students that comprised of the presentation of their 'Business Plans' as well as subsequent Assessment and Q&A session. This invitation came as an acknowledgement by the Co-owner of my achievements in the field of Sales & Marketing and Educating/Coaching business professionals at various companies in Qatar and as University Guest Lecturer earlier in Europe. I am heavily indebted to the Owners of the Philippino Institute Qatar for their invitation, for the experience and knowledge I have accumulated in the course of this milestone event for PI's students.", 'issuer': 'PHILIPPINO INSTITUTE for Sales and Marketing and Business Administration in Qatar', 'date': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'Special Guest to welcome The Hon Martin Hamilton-Smith, MP, Minister for Investment and Trade of South Autralia ', 'description': 'Being a member of Qatar Australia New Zealand Business Association (QANZBA), I had the special opportunity of meeting The Hon Martin Hamilton-Smith, MP, the then Minister for Investment and Trade of South Australia, in March 2017 when he and his delegation were visiting Qatar.\nThanking to my direct contact to The Hon Minister himself (and members of his delegation, too) who said the followings in his \'Ministerial Acknowledgement\' letter after our discussion in Doha:\n"Thank you for your email of 17 March 2017 in relation to Paragon Shipping and Logistics (Qatar) and the opportunity to build and strengthen partnerships with South Australia. It was great pleasure to meet you at the Qatar Australia New Zealand Business Association networking function in Doha on Wednesday 15 march 2017.... Qatar is a highly valued partner of South Australia, with two-way trade during the 2015-16 year valued at AUS Dollar 34.9 million... South Australia has a strong focus on engagement ... with Qatar through a well targeted South Australia - Middle East North Africa Action Plan... South Australia will consider the option to visit Qatar again next year as part of an annual delegation to the region. I look forward to future opportunities to meet with you."', 'issuer': 'Qatar Australia New Zealand Business Association (QANZBA)', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'Master of Ceremonies at the ITU Telecom World Handover Gala Qatar 2014 ', 'description': "I did the honours to serve as Master of Ceremony at the ITU Telecom World Handover Gala Qatar 2014 - Hungary 2015 that was organised by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Hungary and Hungary's Ambassador to Doha and hosted 300 dignitaries and distinguished guests from across the world at The Ritz-Carlton Doha on 9th December, 2014.", 'issuer': "Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Hungary and H.E. Hungary's Ambassador to Doha", 'date': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, {'title': 'Special invitation to the QATAR - MALTA BUSINESS FORUM Doha 2014', 'description': 'Special invitation received from QCCI to the QATAR-MALTA BUSINESS FORUM as Global BDM held in March 2014 - to welcome the official visit of top-notch Maltese Trade Delegation headed up by Head of Malta Chamber of Commerce - in Doha at the HQs of QCCI with the aim to further strengthen relations between the two countries - also including platforms provided by themed international exhibitions covering various fields that TRANS CONTINENT Exhibitions & Conferences specialised in (incl. FIRST QATAR SME Exhibition, Q-REX Real Estate Development Exhibition). ', 'issuer': 'Qatar Chamber of Commerce & Industry', 'date': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, {'title': 'Special invitation to the QATAR - JAPAN BUSINESS FORUM Doha 2013', 'description': 'Special invitation received from QCCI to the QATAR-JAPAN BUSINESS FORUM as Global BDM held on Aug 29, 2013 - COINCIDING with the official visit of Japanese Prime Minister, HE Shinzo Abe to Qatar. The Forum, also attended by the Japanese Prime Minister as Guest of Honour, was held in Doha with the aim to further strengthen relations between the two countries - also including platforms provided by themed international exhibitions covering various fields that TRANS CONTINENT Exhibitions & Conferences specialised in (incl. FIRST QATAR SME Exhibition, Q-REX Real Estate Development Exhibition).', 'issuer': 'Qatar Chamber of Commerce & Industry', 'date': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, {'title': ' Special invitation to the QATARI-FRENCH BUSINESS FORUM in Doha', 'description': 'Special invitation received as Global BDM from QCCI to the QATARI-FRENCH BUSINESS FORUM held on Jun 24, 2013 - COINCIDING with the official visit of French President Francois Hollande to Doha. The Forum, also attended by Mr. Francois Hollande as Guest of Honour, held in Doha, was aimed at further strengthening relations between the two countries - also including platforms provided by themed international exhibitions covering various fields that TRANS CONTINENT Exhibitions & Conferences specialised in (incl. FIRST QATAR SME Exhibition, Q-REX Real Estate Development Exhibition)', 'issuer': 'Qatar Chamber of Commerce & Industry', 'date': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, {'title': 'Certificate of Appreciation', 'description': "Certificate of Appreciation awarded by Hungarian Chamber of Commerce & Industry's Committee for Hungarian-Arabic Relations for my outstanding performance as English-Hungarian/ Hungarian-English interpreter as well as member of top-level Qatari delegation - members of Qatar Chamber and executives of leading Qatari companies - present to welcome top-level HCCI delegation of companies from Hungary that visited Doha in May 2013 to develop and strengthen bilateral business relations.", 'issuer': 'HUNGARIAN Chamber of Commerce & Industry - Hungarian-Arab Committee', 'date': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, {'title': 'Certificate of Appreciation', 'description': 'At the invitation of the then GM of ADCCI, Mr. Mohammad Halal Al Muhiri, Certificate of Appreciation awarded by the ADCCI for my outstanding performance as member of top-level delegation - members of ADCCI, top-level executives (CEOs, GMs, MDs, chairmen, presidents, VPs) of leading Abu Dhabi-based companies - that visited Doha at the invitation of Qatar Chamber of Commerce & Industry in January 2013 to develop and strengthen bilateral Abu Dhabi – Qatar business relations.', 'issuer': 'ABU DHABI Chamber of Commerce & Industry (ADCCI)', 'date': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, {'title': 'University Guest Lecturer on "Business in the Arab World with special regard to the GCC"', 'description': 'As Specialist Guest Lecturer, at the invitation of Prof. Ferenc Kiss, Rector of Budapest College for Communication and Business (BCCB) in Budapest, Hungary, I did the honours to introduce "Culture and Business in the Arab Gulf Region" to the students and arranged a subsequent Q&A session. This introduction on Business in the Arab World - initiated by the Rector - was held as part of the series of lectures, titled "Business in Regions of the World", where specialists of other leading regions of the business world were also invited to introduce their regions to the students. ', 'issuer': 'Budapest METROPOLITAN University, Hungary', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, {'title': 'Guest of Honour to welcome & host top-level Ministerial and Corporate GCC Delegation visiting Hungary', 'description': 'As Regional Director - Gulf region & North Africa, having built top-level relations with diplomatic circles and leading companies of the Gulf region and North Africa, at the invitation of H.E. Saad Faraj Al Kubaisi, former First Secretary of the Embassy of the State of Qatar to Budapest, Hungary, I did the honours to attend events organised by the Embassy of Qatar in Budapest for the top-level Ministerial and Corporate Delegation of the six GCC member countries - related to sports, education and youths - during their week-long visit to Hungary. My gratitude goes out to my time-honoured mentor, presently Deputy Head of the Embassy of the State of Qatar to the State of Panamá, for his tireless efforts and support for me to further develop and strengthen my professional relationships to the GCC member countries. ', 'issuer': 'Embassy of State of Qatar to Budapest', 'date': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, {'title': 'University Guest of Honour Member of Board of Graduation and Final Examination on "Logistics Management"', 'description': 'As specialist guest, at the invitation of Emeritus Prof. Dr. Dr. hc. Imre KNOLL, D. Sc., ELA Fellow, Hungary, I did the honours to take part as Honour Member of Board during the graduation and final examination of the students and subsequent Q&A session - as an acknowledgement from Prof. Dr. KNOLL of my development and achievements in the field of Logistics for DHL Hungary with the guidance and generous support of the Dean of the Science of Logistics and Supply Chain Management in Hungary and Europe. I am heavily indebted to Prof. Dr. KNOLL for his invitation, the experience and knowledge I have accumulated in the course of this milestone event, not to mention the decades of frequent meetings and collaborations that followed our first meeting back in 1993-94.', 'issuer': 'Gödöllő Szent Istvan University, Hungary, Institute of Logistics Management', 'date': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}}]

projects:
[{'title': 'Change Management of Sales Department of FEIBRA LLC in Hungary', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'description': "Originally, as Senior Business Development Advisor to Austrian Post Group A.G., being responsible for providing full-scale advisory services, support and assistance to the Group in their day-to-day business development campaign in Hungary (and other CEE countries), thanking to the full-scale support of Igor Subow, I was assigned by ÖPAG to take responsibility for the preparations and implementation of organizational changes and business transformation of the Sales Department of FEIBRA Hungary LLC, the newly-acquired member of Austrian Post Group AG. This activity included interviewes with members of the then existing Sales Department, working in liaison with Mr. Manuel Geyer and his team from Austria to analyse the then actual conduct of business, individual roles & responsibilities, to prepare proposals for the actual changes that were needed in order to streamline the actual functioning of the Department and to align its operation with that in Vienna. This was another outstanding opportunity that provided me with multiple first-hand experiences and skills as well as enhanced my professional assets, thanking to Igor Subow, Manuel and their team of Austrian Post AG, Europe's first standardised (incumbent) postal services provider, ever since the year of 1490.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miklos', 'last_name': 'Gergely (Nicholas)', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Global Connectivity | Value Creation | Transformation | Corporate Culture | Education | Growth'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Manuel', 'last_name': 'Geyer', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Managing Director & Member of Supervisory Board'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Igor', 'last_name': 'Subow (Игорь Зубов)', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Co-Founder at Asia Post Group'}]}, {'title': 'GLOBAL SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT PARTNER', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'I RECEIVED COOPERATION REQUEST directly from FI.MO.TEC. SpA, Italy, seeking a Global Supply Chain Management Partner.

FIMO® is a global leader in Mobile Telecom Networks market, manufacturing a large selection of accessories for the sector with 60+ distributors all over the world, covers geographic areas/regions in:
- Italy
- India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, China
- Germany, UK
- France, North Africa, Francophone countries
- USA, Canada, Mexico
- Singapore, rest of Southeast Asia

1. Shipments from INDIA to ITALY  - TO BEGIN WITH
2. Imports of raw materials from the WORLD to ITALY, exports of finished goods from ITALY to the WORLD

I initiated from scratch a Global Supply Chain Management Project of such scale, took active role in milestone activities during the preparatory process, assisted in identifying opportunities, addressed critical challenges and helped transform the global operations of FIMO®. I was delighted by Mr. Martinoia, Mr. Perazzi and their Team for the assignment of this Project to my company as well as to Mr. Sujit S. Varma utilising my direct personal contribution - in Europe - for the success of the preparatory phase and allowing me to accumulate further experiences and knowledge in the field through this great opportunity with some of the best. Thank you, Gentlemen.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miklos', 'last_name': 'Gergely (Nicholas)', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Global Connectivity | Value Creation | Transformation | Corporate Culture | Education | Growth'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Sujit S. Varma', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Paolo', 'last_name': 'Perazzi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'CEO, GM, CRO, Business Development, M&A, Board member, available for permanent and temporary employement'}]}, {'title': 'Country Study on Egypt for Waste Management Project for "Remediation and Decommissioning of Landfill Operations & Waste-to-Energy opportunity', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'description': 'Initiated by Prof. Dr. Ali Elsawy, Professor of Architecture, Dep't of Architecture - Faculty of Engineering, Cairo University I concluded several months of investigation and research on 22nd October, 2010 by the submission - to the management of THERMOSELECT (Switzerland) Hungary and for Prof. Dr. Ali Elsawy - of a 'fact-finding'​ Country Study on Egypt for Waste Management Project for "Remediation and Decommissioning of Landfill Operations & Waste-to-Energy opportunity. The summary of Prof. Dr. Ali El-Sawi's Task Force issued an intriguing 7-point brief initial response in reply to my Project Proposal that defined the fundamental Action Plan designed to involve top-level officers of government authorities related, amongst others, to Waste Management, Environment, Energy in the State of Egypt. Further phases of investigations and analysis were projected - also with full support pledged by the then Ambassador of Egypt to Budapest, H.E. Ali Al-Hefny. As main purpose of my business development activities - from scratch, imminent site visits were planned by the party in Egypt - for the preparation of a long-term cooperation for multiple projects with a combined value of USD several hundred million. This project gave me the unique opportunity to accumulate direct experiences and knowledge through membership on a multinational team of outstanding experts regarding the macro-economic implications of such an enormous and multifaceted programme.
